children.text:
Now, the full code:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, j, k, max_val, current_count, result

  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr, brr

  character(len=20) :: str_result

  read(*,*) n

  allocate(arr(n), brr(n))

  read(*,*) arr(1:n)

  max_val = -1000000000  ! Initialize to a very low value

  do i = 1, n

     do j = i, n

        brr = arr  ! Copy the array

        !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Flip the bits from i to j

        do k = i, j

           if (brr(k) == 0) then

              brr(k) = 1

           else

              brr(k) = 0

           end if

        end do

        ! Count the number of 1s

        current_count = 0

        do k = 1, n

           if (brr(k) == 1) current_count = current_count +1

        end do

        if (current_count > max_val) then

           max_val = current_count

        end if

     end do

  end do

  ! Handle n=1 case

  if (n ==1) then

     if (arr(1) ==1) then

        result =0

     else

        result =1

     end if

  else

     result = max_val

  end if

  ! Now process through second program's logic

  write(str_result, '(i0)') result

  ! Replace commas with spaces

  integer :: len_str, i_char

  len_str = len_trim(str_result)

  do i_char =1, len_str

     if (str_result(i_char:i_char) == ',') then

        str_result(i_char:i_char) = ' '

     end if

  end do

  print *, trim(str_result)

  deallocate(arr, brr)

end program main

children.text:
In Fortran, variables can be declared in any order, but all declarations must be before any executable statements. So the code should have all declarations first. So the correct order is:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, j, k, max_val, current_count, result, len_str, i_char

  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr, brr

  character(len=20) :: str_result

  read(*,*) n

  allocate(arr(n), brr(n))

  read(*,*) arr(1:n)

  max_val = -1000000000

  ... loops ...

  ... compute result ...

  write(str_result, '(i0)') result

  len_str = len_trim(str_result)

  do i_char =1, len_str

     if (str_result(i_char:i_char) == ',') then

        str_result(i_char:i_char) = ' '

     end if

  end do

  print *, trim(str_result)

  deallocate(arr, brr)

end
children.label: code_analysis

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, j, k, max_val, current_count, result

  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr, brr

  character(len=20) :: str_result

  read(*,*) n

  allocate(arr(n), brr(n))

  read(*,*) arr(1:n)

  max_val = -1000000000  ! Initialize to a very low value

  do i = 1, n

     do j = i, n

        brr = arr  ! Copy the array

        ! Flip the bits from i to j

        do k = i, j

           if (brr(k) == 0) then

              brr(k) = 1

           else

              brr(k) = 0

           end if

        end do

        ! Count the number of 1s

        current_count = 0

        do k = 1, n

           if (brr(k) == 1) current_count = current_count +1

        end do

        if (current_count > max_val) then

           max_val = current_count

        end if

     end do

  end do

  ! Handle n=1 case

  if (n ==1) then

     if (arr(1) ==1) then

        result =0

     else

        result =1

     end if

  else

     result = max_val

  end if

  ! Now process through second program's logic

  write(str_result, '(i0)') result

  ! Replace commas with spaces

  integer :: len_str, i_char

  len_str = len_trim(str_result)

  do i_char =1, len_str

     if (str_result(i_char:i_char) == ',') then

        str_result(i_char:i_char) = ' '

     end if

  end do

  print *, trim(str_result)

  deallocate(arr, brr)

end program main

  integer :: n, i, j, k, max_val, current_count, result, len_str, i_char

  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr, brr

     if (str_result(i_char:i_char) == ',') then

        str_result(i_char:i_char) = ' '

     end if

  end do

  print *, trim(str_result)

  deallocate(arr, brr)

end program main
